docs.snippet: With a possible government shutdown looming this weekend, the House and Senate passed a vast spending plan that funds the government through September.

headline.print_headline: $1.3 Trillion Spending Bill Is Passed on to the Senate
headline.main: Congress Approves $1.3 Trillion Spending Bill, Averting a Shutdown

docs.snippet: Supply chains are so complicated, companies might not be able to base more production in America, as the administration wants.

headline.print_headline: Tariffs on Imports? What Is an Import?
headline.main: Tariffs on Imports? What Exactly Is an Import?

docs.snippet: China responded to Trump’s action by announcing tariffs on $3 billion worth of U.S. products, a relatively modest amount. But it has more weapons in its arsenal.

headline.print_headline: Why Beijing’s Response  Has Been Rather Muted
headline.main: Why China’s Response to Trump’s Tariffs Is So Muted

docs.snippet: As China’s state-directed economy marches forward, Washington is stuck in neutral and the American economy is in danger of falling behind.

headline.print_headline: Is China’s Version of Capitalism Winning?
headline.main: Is China’s Version of Capitalism Winning?

docs.snippet: I paid too much attention to rules about candidates’ behavior and credentials, and too little to rules about who gets to vote and whose votes matter the most.

headline.main: What a Times Political Reporter Learned From the 2016 Election

docs.snippet: Picking the pockets of struggling Americans to line the pockets of the lenders.

headline.main: Congress Considers Going Easy on Predatory Lenders

docs.snippet: Why would any policymaker with the agenda or values she espouses work for a president so determined to lay waste to them?

headline.main: Ivanka Trump’s Brand Building at the White House

docs.snippet: The two-pronged trade offensive aimed at China, and China’s initial response, may be only the start of a complex, escalating economic battle.

headline.main: Tariff Battle: Where the U.S. and Chinese Moves May Lead

docs.snippet: Some undocumented immigrants are already wary of plans to ask 2020 census respondents whether they are United States citizens.

headline.print_headline: If Asked, Some Already Have an Answer: No Comment
headline.main: If Census Asks About Citizenship, Some Already Have an Answer: No Comment
